00019 /**
00020  * @file   RegressionCheck.h
00021  * @author Chuck Sugnet
00022  * @date   Tue Apr 25 16:02:08 2006
00023  * 
00024  * @brief  Virtual class for checks to be done after a regression test.
00025  */
00026 
00027 #ifndef REGRESSIONCHECK_H
00028 #define REGRESSIONCHECK_H
00029 
00030 #include "util/Util.h"
00031 #include "util/Verbose.h"
00032 //
00033 #include "portability/affy-base-types.h"
00034 //
00035 #include <cstring>
00036 #include <string>
00037 //
00038 
00039 /**
00040  * Abstract base class (i.e. interface) for checks to be run during a regression
00041  * test.
00042  */
00043 class RegressionCheck {
00044 
00045 public:
00046  
00047   /** Constructor */
00048   RegressionCheck() : m_Name("test"), m_NegTest(false), m_MaxErrorsReport(30), m_CurrentErrorsReported(0)
00049   { }
00050 
00051   /** Virtual destructor for virtual class. */
00052   virtual ~RegressionCheck() {}
00053 
00054   /** 
00055    * Check the condition expected.
00056    * @param msg - Message to be optionally set while checking.
00057    * @return - true if passed, false otherwise.
00058    */
00059   virtual bool check(std::string &msg) = 0;
00060 
00061 protected:
00062   /** 
00063    * Utility function to see if a condition is true and if not to add
00064    * the message to our summary of messages.
00065    * @param condition - boolean to be tested.
00066    * @param msg - informative message for this condition (if fails)
00067    * @param summary - ongoing collection of messages.
00068    * @return - condition test results.
00069    */
00070   bool checkMsg(bool condition, const std::string &msg, std::string &summary) {
00071     if(!condition) {
00072       summary += msg;
00073       reportError(msg);
00074     }
00075     return condition;
00076   }
00077 
00078   /** 
00079    * Utility function to accumulate error messages
00080    * @param err - error message
00081    * @return - void
00082    */
00083   void reportError(const std::string &err) {
00084     // APT-992
00085 #ifndef _WIN32    
00086         if(m_CurrentErrorsReported++ < m_MaxErrorsReport) {
00087       Verbose::out(1, "Error encountered: " + err);
00088       if(m_CurrentErrorsReported >= m_MaxErrorsReport) {
00089         Verbose::out(1, "Maximum number of errors reported.");
00090       }
00091     }
00092 #endif
00093   }
00094 
00095   /** 
00096    * Utility function to set the max number of errors to report
00097    * @param max - maximum number of errors to report (-1 for no limit)
00098    * @return - void
00099    */
00100   void setMaxError(int max) {
00101     m_MaxErrorsReport = max;
00102   }
00103 
00104   /** 
00105    * Are two floats within epsilon (small value) of eachother?
00106    * 
00107    * @param gold - correct value.
00108    * @param gen - value to be tested.
00109    * @param eps - epsilon, small number they can be different but still equivalent.
00110    *            i.e. if |generated-gold| >= eps then there is a difference.
00111    * @param success - boolean set to false if floats not equivalent.
00112    * @param maxDiff - Maximum difference seen so far.
00113    * @param log - boolean set to true if differences to be reported.
00114    * @param frac - Maximum accepted fractional difference in numeric values (not used by default).
00115    *            i.e. if |generated-gold| >= frac*max(|generated|,|gold|) then there is a difference.
00116    * @return - true if floats equivalent, false otherwise.
00117    */
00118   bool checkFloat(float gold, float gen, double eps, bool &success, double &maxDiff, bool log = false, double frac = 0) {
00119     bool localSuccess = true;
00120     // bug fix: proper equivalence test when one or both values to compare are non-finite (see ClearQuest AFFY00024123)
00121       if (!Util::isFinite(gold) && !Util::isFinite(gen)) {
00122         // test pair of non-finite values for equivalence (both NAN or both INF with same sign)
00123         if ( (gold>0)==(gen>0) && (gold<0)==(gen<0) ) {
00124             return success;
00125         }
00126         success = localSuccess = false;
00127         if (log) {
00128             reportError("Non-finite non-equivalent floats. gold: '" + ToStr(gold) + "' test: '" + ToStr(gen) + "'");
00129         }
00130         return localSuccess;
00131       }
00132       if (!Util::isFinite(gold) || !Util::isFinite(gen)) {
00133         // finite and non-finite values can never be equivalent
00134         success = localSuccess = false;
00135         if (log) {
00136             reportError("One float non-finite difference. gold: '" + ToStr(gold) + "' test: '" + ToStr(gen) + "'");
00137         }
00138         return localSuccess;
00139       }
00140       
00141       double diff = fabs(gold - gen);
00142       maxDiff = Max(diff, maxDiff);
00143       
00144       // allowed absolute difference from fractional tolerance (zero by default)
00145       double eps2 = frac*Max( fabs(gold), fabs(gen) );
00146       // absolute difference is acceptable if it satisfies either (least restrictive) tolerance
00147       if (diff > Max(eps,eps2)) {
00148         success = localSuccess = false;
00149         if (log) {
00150             reportError("Different floats. gold: '" + ToStr(gold) + "' test: '" + ToStr(gen) + "'");
00151         }
00152         return localSuccess;
00153       }
00154       return localSuccess;
00155   }
00156  
00157 public:
00158   std::string m_Name;
00159   bool m_NegTest;
00160 
00161 private:
00162 
00163   int m_MaxErrorsReport;        /// The maximum number of errors to report
00164   int m_CurrentErrorsReported;  /// The current number of reported errors
00165 
00166 };
00167 
00168 
00169 #endif /* REGRESSIONCHECK_H */
